ETYMOLOGY: From New Latin *retina*, from Latin *rete* 'net' (due to its net-like appearance), probably by way of medieval Latin *retina tela* 'net-like membrane'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A layer at the back of the eyeball containing cells sensitive to light, which trigger nerve impulses that pass via the optic nerve to the brain, forming a visual image.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 眼球后部的一层细胞，含有对光敏感的细胞，这些细胞通过视神经向大脑传递神经冲动，从而形成视觉图像。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Damage to the retina can lead to permanent vision loss.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 视网膜受损可能导致永久性视力丧失。
